title: Delish party recipes for Diwali
text: If you are throwing a grand party for friends and family this Diwali, go for a menu that will have both traditional and global dishes. These recipes will help you devise a sparkling spread, promising a delectable mix of East and West.70 gms Polenta40 ml Milk50 ml Water20 gms Butter15 gms Parmesan cheeseSalt to taste1 gm White pepper20 ml Olive oil10 gms Garlic5 gms Onion10 gms Celery20 gms Green zucchini20 gms Yellow zucchini15 gms Bell pepper10 gms Capsicum10 gms Black olivesA little bit of PepperA little bit of Chilli flakesA little bit of OreganoA little bit of BasilA little bit of White wineAs per servings, get tartsA little bit of Tomato sauceA little bit of Rocket leavesA little bit of CreamTake a pan, add water and milk together in it along with a pinch of salt. Boil on low heat.As the water boils, slowly add polenta and keep stirring, otherwise there could be lumps.Cook for 10 minutes.Once the polenta gets tight, add some white pepper and mix them.Finish it with parmesan cheese. Switch off the flame and put butter in the end.Take a big tart and set the filling in it. Keep aside.Take another frying pan. Put olive oil, garlic, onion and celery and saute them.Add all the vegetables.Add salt, pepper, chilli flakes, oregano and basil and saute everything together. Put some white wine and as the item gets thick, put tomato sauce and cook for 5-6 minutes.Add some cream and toss it with some parmesan cheese on low flamePut this filling in the tart that was kept asideAs far as plating is concerned, pour some tomato sauce and spread it, place the tart on it. On top of the tart, put some rocket leaves.Recipe by Ozora, Kolkata
description: No Diwali celebration will be complete without a delish spread. Try these recipes that will simply wow your loved ones.
